admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa

abstracts.cdata!:
The Energy Conservation Demonstration
            Project will:  (i) help the Agency for Energy Conservation
            (AME) develop an effective institutional and policy
            framework for a national energy conservation program; (ii)
            strengthen AME's abilities as well as the local
            consulting capabilities and implement energy efficiency
            actions at the users' level.  In addition, the Energy
            Conservation Demonstration Project will (iii) finance the
            development and implementation of specific, short-term
            actions (technical assistance and basic equipment) for 28
            selected enterprises to demonstrate the benefits of energy
            conservation to other users in the same sectors.  The
            project will yield an average total energy saving estimated
            at some US$3.4 million per year (at crude oil prices of
            US$15 per barrel).
